choices.C: An Administration Server keeps a domain log, but a Managed Server does not
choices.B: A domain must have at least one of each type of server
choices.E: Java EE applications are deployed only to a Managed Server
choices.A: An Administration Server manages the domain configuration
choices.D: A Managed Server keeps a server log, but an Administration Server does not

questions.question_text: Which two statements are true when an Administration Server is compared to a Managed Server? (Choose two.)

discussion.content: A and C are the correct answers.

choices.A: Use all machines in the domain
choices.B: Use machines whose names match an expression
choices.D: Use all machines in a subnet
choices.C: Use a percentage of machines in the domain

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: ABE
There is no option to use dynamic cluster to choose machines in a subnet, I believe that the correct option are A, B and E

A,B,E
Use any machine configured in this domain: The dynamic servers generated are assigned in a round-robin fashion to all machines defined in the domain.
"Any" machine, I think doesn't mean "all" machines even at a "domain" or "subnet" level, as choices A or D answers.

D. Use all machines in a subnet, I think would be correct if instead of "subnet" is "subset" because this choice applies for "Use any machine configured in this domain" when you Create a New Dynamic Cluster

questions.question_text: When creating a dynamic cluster, you have multiple options concerning how dynamic servers are distributed across machines in your domain. Identify three supported configurations. (Choose three.)

choices.D: Views the rows from a specific time range.
choices.C: Change the order of the displayed columns.
choices.A: Store the rows by a specific column.
choices.B: Limit the number of rows displayed.

questions.question_text:
You are using the Administration console to monitor a resource.
Which three techniques can you use to customize the monitoring output?

discussion.content: A. is "Sort the rows by a specific column."

choices.F: Kill a server process that did not shut down property.
choices.E: Kill a failed application on a server.

questions.question_text: Which three tasks can be performed by the Node Manager?

You decide to use a database to store WebLogic Server transaction logs for a managed server.
Which two steps are required to configure this? (Choose two.)

choices.A: Under the managed server's Services configuration select "JDBC" as the type for the transaction log store.
choices.C: Create a non-XA data source in the domain for the database transaction log.
choices.D: Create an XA data source in the domain for the database transaction log.
choices.B: Under the managed server's Services configuration, select " Disable the Default Store".
